instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
hello


working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a logic board

looks very clean, no liquid damage, under the microscope couldn’t find anything that looks bad…

the board is dead, no light on the charger..


on F6905 i get around 16.73v on each side

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.295v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.393v


resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> showing 6.8 m ohms and dropping, on diode mode showing 0.422 v



on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> showing 2.929 k ohms

seems to be ok, also the voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> but still no green or orange light on charger… (maybe bad dc in board? will try to get another one tomorrow to test with..)




i checked the one wire circuit

on <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> 

pin 5 = 0.728v

pin 4 = 0.780v

pin 1 = 3.378v 




a note :
<CHIP>U8900</CHIP> seems like been worked on with remaining of flux, but i doubt it has anything to do with the issue of no power…



any advice on what to check next?


thanks…

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
Check voltages at pins 5 & 8 of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
Post some voltages at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, pins 1, 2, 3, 19, 20, 9, 15, 27, 28.
Alsos check for short/low value at secondary supplies (big coils).

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL. Also inspect ISL and SMC area for any signs of corrosion

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
i have no <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> on this boardview or schematic for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
pin 1 = 0.028v
pin 2 = 16.41v
pin 3 = 1.51v
pin 19 = 5.39v
pin 20 = 5.43v
pin 9 = 0.033v
pin 15 = 0.060v
pin 27 = 0.031v
pin 28 = 0.032v


resistance between pin 17 and 18 of the isl (<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) is 4.1 ohm
resistance between pin 27 and 28 of the isl (<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) is 0.8 ohm

pin 27 28 seems voltage is low and also resistance? meaning a short?

both smc and isl area are very clean, no corrosion...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
ok after some more measuring
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> reading o.l and 37k ohms

bad resistors? need to go along with the isl or just those?

could make sense that this the problem?

btw, the reason for not having green light is probably because the dc in board.
couldn't get another dc in board but checked on another board and also no green light there..

thanks...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message: First USE known good DC in board. If both of those are reading that high, they are blown and need to be replaced. Remeasure between pins 27 and 28 and make sure it's a high resistance. If it's 0.8 ohms, then the ISL could be shorting the lines to ground or <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/21/22 could be shorting it to ground.  There is also a chance the traces are blown between them and the ISL or them and <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>. Check traces and replace resistors.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
"pin 3 = 1.51v"
That is very bad; ACIN should jave aprox 4V.

Check <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is the last option...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead no light on charger
threads.message:
ok so after replacing <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> with good ones from another board
i plugged it in and instantly they blown and went bad again..

i pulled everything on the line between pins 27 and 28 and the short was still there
so finally it was clear, the ISL is bad!
i replaced the ISL with a new one, put all the original caps back and two "new" resistors.

after measuring to make sure the short is gone
i plugged it in, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.61 and..
the board now works like a charm.. (:

solved!

thank you very much !
